title: Iran's Nuclear Program Continues After US Strikes, Damage Disputed
snippets: Iran's nuclear program has been dealt a blow, here's an overview of the current state of its facilities.
Iran refuses to dismantle its nuclear programme and it’s still impossible to verify the damage done by air strikes.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMib0FVX3lxTFBqU3JtakROYjU3VzhmVUN6bEZXdUVKblhhXzJsTGZpY29FcFp4X1BjanBJc3M5djFfV1VSSWRvVE1mT1dpUHVKdGV3cV9zTjdkUkg1ZkR6ZHUyMzVIN2dVd1BaZ3FUYk9TNi04T1ctSQ?oc=5" target="_blank">Iran's Khamenei claims U.S. strike didn't cause major damage to nuclear facil
President Trump’s claimed Iran’s capabilities were “obliterated.” The full extent of the damage is still emerging.
titles: Obliterated? Damaged? Inoperable? What's known about Iran's nuclear facilities
What’s next for Iran’s nuclear programme?
Iran's Khamenei claims U.S. strike didn't cause major damage to nuclear facilities - Axios
What We Know About the Fate of Iran’s Nuclear Program
Trump closes NATO summit promising proof Iran’s nuclear program destroyed
summary: Iran's nuclear program remains operational despite claims of significant damage by U.S. airstrikes, which Iran's leadership disputes. The true extent of any damage is yet to be fully determined, as Iran has not dismantled its nuclear facilities and verification is challenging. President Trump has claimed the program was "obliterated," but this assertion is contradicted by Iran's Supreme Leader Khamenei, who states the impact was not major. The situation remains unresolved, with the full impact of the strikes still emerging.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about the current state of Iran's nuclear program and the impact of U.S. airstrikes, which could help readers understand the geopolitical situation. However, it does not report on any attempts to solve the problem or provide clear insights into the causes or potential impacts of the situation.

title: CDC Panel Recommends Annual Flu Shots, Advises Against Thimerosal Use
snippets: The CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices voted on the flu vaccine, raising concerns about a rarely used preservative. Medical groups worry this will "sow distrust" in vaccines.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiigFBVV95cUxObFYwWjdMVHd1TXp6eDZnU29JSXl5cEFrWFVhVjNSR2d5Tmg5OWdWTHdPamJTbDUwclBlazhvdUhya2pwZ1NnalViZWxtaUl3UnkzSzVJVU93NWx1TDJDaG0xUHppZ3AyUnNiU1h6RF9GdldXQ0FtLVNVTlZRdkU3cU50Nk84M1NmdGc?oc=5" target="_blank">RFK Jr.'s vaccine advisors recommend RSV
The CDC's vaccine advisory committee voted to recommend annual flu vaccines but against flu shots containing the preservative thimerosal

titles: RFK Jr.'s vaccine advisers raise disproven fears about the preservative thimerosal

CDC vaccine advisory panel recommends against flu vaccines containing thimerosal

summary: The CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices voted to recommend annual flu vaccines but advised against the use of flu shots containing the preservative thimerosal. This decision has sparked concerns among medical groups that it may lead to increased distrust in vaccines. Additionally, the committee's approval of Merck's flu shot comes after significant changes to the panel by RFK Jr., including the appointment of known vaccine critics.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it provides actionable insights for the reader (recommendation for annual flu shots and advice against thimerosal use) and increases awareness about the debate surrounding vaccine safety. However, it does not highlight any progress or solutions to the issue of vaccine distrust, hence it doesn't score the highest.

title: Utah Jazz Drafts Ace Bailey Fifth, Despite His Warning Not to Select Him
snippets: Ace Bailey's representatives informed a team drafting inside the top five that they didn't want that team to select the Rutgers wing and that he wouldn't report if it did, sources told ESPN.

summary: Ace Bailey, a Rutgers wing, was selected fifth in the NBA Draft by the Utah Jazz, despite his representatives warning a top-five team he would not report if chosen by them. This situation unfolded after Bailey's agents explicitly communicated his unwillingness to join certain teams prior to the draft.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about the NBA Draft process and the power dynamics between players and teams. title: Apple Updates EU App Store Policies to Comply with Digital Markets Act
snippets: The move shows that Apple may be able to make smaller changes to satisfy regulators.

Apple has introduced new App Store changes in the EU in an attempt to avoid being further penalized under the European Union’s Digital Markets Act (DMA). On Thursday, the company announced a new tier system for its Store Services fee that’s applied to purchases made outside apps, and it will only gi

Apple on Thursday announced a series of updates to its developer policies to comply with the EU’s Digital Markets Act (DMA). The news, which was expected, arrived just in time to meet the deadline of June 26, after which the iPhone maker would risk new fines. The changes involve both how app d
titles: Apple reveals complex system of App Store fees to avoid EU fine of 500 million euro

summary: Apple has introduced updates to its App Store policies in the European Union to comply with the Digital Markets Act (DMA), aiming to avoid further penalties. The company announced a new tier system for Store Services fees for purchases made outside of apps and updated developer policies. These changes, announced on Thursday, were made to meet the June 26 deadline, after which Apple would have faced new fines under the DMA.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about changes in Apple's App Store policies, which could affect developers and users alike. It also provides context about the Digital Markets Act, thus increasing awareness about regulatory measures in the tech industry. However, it does not highlight any specific solutions or progress.

title: Judge, Ohtani Elected MLB All-Star Starters; Lead Fan Votes
snippets: Aaron Judge led the majors in All-Star Game votes, while Shohei Ohtani led the NL, as the two superstars were elected as starters by fans Thursday.

NEW YORK — Aaron Judge is heading to his seventh Midsummer Classic. title: Microsoft Changes Iconic BSOD Color to Black After 40 Years
snippets: The software giant's blue screen of death dates back to the early 1990s, according to longtime Microsoft developer Raymond Chen.

Nearly every Windows user has had a run in with the infamous “Blue Screen of Death” at some point in their computing life. titles: Microsoft says goodbye to the Windows blue screen of death

summary: After over 40 years, Microsoft is changing the color of its notorious "Blue Screen of Death" (BSOD) to black. This update marks a significant shift from the iconic blue background that has been synonymous with Windows system errors since the early 1990s. The decision to change the color follows widespread familiarity among users with the BSOD, although the exact reason for the color transition was not specified. This update will soon be implemented, altering how system errors are visually communicated to users of Windows operating systems.

summary: Researchers have successfully harnessed quantum mechanics to generate secure random numbers, leveraging the phenomenon known as "spooky action at a distance." The achievement marks a practical application of quantum weirdness in improving cybersecurity.
